vtipy package¶

Submodules¶

vtipy.helpers module¶

vtipy.helpers.start(measure_times='measurement_times.txt')¶

This function writes a new file called ‘measurement_times.txt’ into the working directory. A header is writen into the file with the startime of the experiment.

vtipy.impedance module¶

class vtipy.impedance.solartron1260(Vac=0.5, Vdc=0.0, integration_time=1)¶

Bases: Gpib.Gpib.Gpib

This object controlls the Solartron 1260

Here is a description of how it works:

TODO: add more description here.
measure_frequency(frequency)¶

This function measures the impedance at a given frequency.

Parameters:frequency (float) – frequency for measurement.
Returns:result – Impedance data formated as a comma separated string. The first three values (frequency, magnitude, and the argument) are the important values that need to be saved.
Return type:string
measure_impedance(scan_number, filename=None, fmin=0.05, fmax=9800000.0, ppd=20, Tset=None, Tcell=None, scan_label=None)¶

Executes the solartron1260.measure_impedance_process method as a subprocess as to allow a main control script to continue to monitor temperature while this runs in parallel.

Parameters:
  • scan_number (int) – indicates order of scan measurement.
  • (None/string (filename) – name of file in which impedance data is stored. If left as None it will be assigned a name based on the scan number: “scan_{}.txt”.format(scan_number), however, it may be set to something else to distinguish it from a typical scan.
  • fmin (float) – minimum frquency for sweep. Default is 0.05.
  • fmax (float) – max frequency for sweep. Default is 9.8e6.
  • ppd (int) – points per decade. Default is 20.
  • Tset (int, optional) – Setpoint temperature from the Eurotherm. If set it is stored in the header of the datafile. It should be set during variable temperature experiments.
  • Tcell (int, optional) – Set this to the “cell temperature” as measured as measured by the MAX31855 thermocouple.
  • scan_label (string, optional) – Optional label to provide extra meta-data for later analysis. Typically this is set to “up” or “down” to distinguish measurements during an upward or downward tempeature sweep.
measure_impedance_process(scan_number, filename, fmin, fmax, ppd, Tset, Tcell, scan_label)¶

Instructs the solartron to measure the impedance over a range of frequencies. In a main control script this method is called by the solartron1260.measure_impedance method as a subprocess to allow the main control script to continue to measure the temperature while the impedance scan is executed in parallel.

For the deffinitions of the arguments please see the docs for the solartron1260.measure_impedance method. The arguments are identical and are passed from that method into this.

Parameters:
  • scan_number (int) – indicates order of scan measurement.
  • filename (string, optional) – name of file in which impedance data is stored. If left as None it will be assigned a name based on the scan number: “scan_{}.txt”.format(scan_number), however, it may be set to something else to distinguish it from a typical scan.
  • fmin (float) – minimum frquency for sweep. Default is 0.05.
  • fmax (float) – max frequency for sweep. Default is 9.8e6.
  • ppd (int) – points per decade. Default is 20.
  • Tset (int) – Setpoint temperature from the Eurotherm. If set it is stored in the header of the datafile. It should be set during variable temperature experiments.
  • Tcell (int) – Set this to the “cell temperature” as measured as measured by the MAX31855 thermocouple.
  • scan_label (string) – Optional label to provide extra meta-data for later analysis. Typically this is set to “up” or “down” to distinguish measurements during an upward or downward tempeature sweep.
send(msg)¶

Sends a message to the solartron. Just like the Gpib.Gpib.write except a 0.02 s sleep time is applied to prevent too many signals being sent at the same time.

Parameters:msg (string) – message to send the solartron. This should be one of the instructions from the instruction set found in the solartron manual.
Returns:
Return type:None

vtipy.temperature module¶

class vtipy.temperature.temperature_controllers(filename, serial_usb_port, addr=1, CLK=25, CS=24, DO=18)¶

Bases: minimalmodbus.Instrument, Adafruit_MAX31855.MAX31855.MAX31855

This class controlls both the MAX31855 and the Eurotherm 3216.

Methods are defined to allow measurement and recording of the temperature from the Eurotherm and the MAX31855 as well as to change the setpoint tempreature of the Eurotherm controller.

This control is acomplished by inheretance from the minimalmodbus.Instrument and MAX31855.MAX31855 classes.

hold(hold_time, temp_resolution=2)¶

This function waits for the specified hold_time and makes temperature measurements at the specified temp_resolution. Specifieds temperature measurements per minute

measure_temperatures()¶

This method serves two purposes:

  1. Measures the cell and furnace temperature.
  2. Records time since the initial temperature measurement (dt), the
    setpoint temperature from the Eurotherm (Tsetpoint)
ramp_temperature(Tset, ramp_time=1)¶

method description

read_process_temperature()¶

Returns the furnace temperature from the Eurotherm

read_setpoint()¶

Returns the setpoint temperature from the Eurotherm

set_setpoint(Tset)¶

Sets the setpoint temperature of the Eurotherm
